(She looks at the broken lucky charm.)

If this is an archdevan pendant, it must be valuable...
Damn! Anyone who breaks something so valuable must be a complete idiot. There's no doubt about that.
I wonder if there's a way to repair it... Of course there is.

If I, Keezar, weren't so brilliant, those abominable archdevas wouldn't have locked me up and performed tests on me, would they?

I'll give it a try!
I made a mistake. Sleep well, my dear archdeva, while I carry out my tests, hehe! "Come to you senses!"

Huh? What was the last thing I said?
Ah yes. You want me to repair this?
What do I need for that...?

That's right! I need that! What's it called again?
That's it, the horn of an archdeva. Bring me that.
I need... no... you need it."Okay."

Keezar, the greatest Khirian genius, didn't seem to be in her right mind.
However, she was the only hope so you have no choice other than to trust in her abilities.

Pretty, pretty horns! "A pointed projection of skin on the head of various animals consisting of a covering of keratin and other proteins surrounding a core of live bone." Ha! Bet you're wondering how I knew that, aren't you?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Is everyone here crazy?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

One horn, two horn, red horn, war-torn.

Not enough, my foreign friend!

Two horn, once worn! More horn, less scorn!

No need to get snippy, . I have waited years in this awful place just to help you on your quest! But now that you're here, we can both go.

Let's talk outside, shall we?"How do I get you out of here?"
Click, click, double-quick! That's the wrong question! The right question is how do I get you out of here, when you're so slow?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What? I'm not slow..."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

How did you find me so soon? I won't go back! You can't make me!

Wait...oh, you're still the same one. What was your name? What was your quest? Have I already asked you about your favorite color?"I need this pendant repaired. Remember?"
A broken control pendant? How did you break this? They're meant to be indestructible and idiot-proof!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"We've already had this conversation!"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I cannot teach this one. No patience.

Fine. Glue you want. Glue you shall have."Finally!"
